meanings.definition: Resembling a willow tree in appearance or characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The branches of the tree were willowier than the others in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The garden had a willowier feel with its drooping branches and slender leaves.
meanings.sent3: The willowier tree seemed to wave at the passing breeze with its long, slender branches.
meanings.sent4: Her hair cascaded down her back, willowier than any other in the room.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the willowier essence of the tree, swaying gracefully in the wind.

meanings.definition: Having more willow trees than something else.
meanings.sent1: The willowier side of the river was a peaceful sanctuary for birds and wildlife.
meanings.sent2: The park on the willowier side of town was a favorite spot for picnics and relaxation.
meanings.sent3: The willowier area of the forest was a haven for those seeking shade and tranquility.
meanings.sent4: The willowier landscape provided a serene backdrop for the quaint village.
meanings.sent5: The willowier grove was a magical place where fairies were said to dwell.
